definitions: To make a proof of; to test the accuracy or quality of something.
To make resistant to something, such as water or fire.
To cause (dough or yeast) to rise by fermentation.
To verify the truth or validity of something.
examples: The editor proofs the manuscript carefully.
He proofs the fabric against water damage.
The baker proofs the dough before baking.
The scientist proofs her hypothesis with data.
